According to the International Banking Commission, Wennerstrom, just days after the Millennium article that brought him down appeared on news stands, began emptying accounts at Bank of Kroenfeld in the Cayman Islands.
That money, approximately two billion Euros, was then spread over a number of accounts with the help of this confederate, seen here in Zurich -

- who converted the funds into private bonds, which, I'm told, are even harder to trace than Wennerstrom himself. Europol has launched a search for the woman who had used a stolen Norwegian passport. Her whereabouts, like her boss's, are unknown.
- shot three times in the head at close range in what is being called a classic gangland execution.
